results.title: Wild planet
results.brief_description: George Bonicelli is an unassuming, naive and likable accountant who has his routine and mundane existence briefly injected with a large dose of fear, exhilaration, speed, colour, movement, liberation and a hint of romance when he runs into Leilah Deluxe, a 340 year old woman from the planet Ultra Terra. Original format 16 mm/colour.

results.title: PANACEA: the documentary
results.creator_credit: Ioannis Ioannou, Cinemedia, Rose Myers, Vanessa Rouse and Arena Theatre Company
results.brief_description: ‘PANACEA the documentary’ follows the journey of Arena Theatre Company’s creative team as they embark on an ambitious large scale performance event fusing modern technology and cinematic devices. A combination of conventional theatre and MTV culture.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ioannis Ioannou, Cinemedia, Rose Myers, Vanessa Rouse and Arena Theatre Company

results.title: Paper plates to silver spoons: the complete guide to table manners
results.brief_description: Designed as a quick guide to table manners, this American production will amuse and inform. Table manners, utensil use, correct posture and table settings are discussed for both formal and informal dining situations. Cultural differences in table manners are also discussed. After watching this, viewers will be able to handle any dining situation with confidence as well as learning when it is acceptable to put elbows on the table and eat with one’s fingers!

results.title: A Girl's own story
results.brief_description:
Set in the Beatlemania of the 1960s, this is a stylised account of girlhood - where perversion is innocent, family is strange and adulthood lonely. From the director of ‘The Piano’ (1993) and ‘In the Cut’ (2003). Original format 16mm/black and white.
WARNING: Some scenes may cause offence to some viewers.

results.title: Desert Conquest
results.creator_credit: Lex Halliday and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description: The story of how the Australian Mutual Provident Society, by a scheme of mass clearing and scientific development transformed over a quarter of a million acres of desert land in South Australia into rich pasture holdings. Shows how the land was cleared and how the men and their families who worked on this project eventually settled on the reclaimed soil on farms of their own.

results.title: Desert cargo
results.creator_credit: A Vickers, Leslie Sansom, British Information Services and Vickers Films
results.brief_description: For the transportation of liquefied natural gas from Algeria to Britain the engineers of Vickers shipbuilding undertake at the Barrow Shipyard the building of a highly specialised tanker. The initial research, construction and testing that led up to the launching of the “Methane Princess” are set against the background of the scheme to bring a new source of energy to Britain and pioneer a new world industry

results.title: Desert bloom
results.creator_credit: Eugene Corr, Michael Hausman and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Set in Las Vegas at the time of the first atom bomb tests in 1951, this powerful drama examines the life of a struggling middle-class Nevada family, seen through the eyes of 13 year old Rose Chismore (Annabeth Gish). Finding life difficult with her war-scarred father (Jon Voight), Rose forms a close bond with her flamboyant Aunt Starr (Ellen Barkin) whose friendship comes at a critical time.

results.title: Pal Joey
results.creator_credit: George Sidney, Fred Kohlmar, George Sidney Productions and Essex
results.brief_description: Pal Joey, starring Frank Sinatra, Kim Novak and Rita Hayworth, is strong, funny entertainment based on a novel by John O’Hara. It features 14 songs from Rodgers and Hart including “The Lady is a Tramp”, “Bewitched, Bothered and Bewildered” and “My Funny Valentine”. Sinatra is an out of heel nightclub singer, Joey Evans, who plays the field with women. He is ideal as the irreverent, glib Joey.

results.title: Des Enfants Gates = Spoiled Children
results.creator_credit: Bertrand Tavernier, Michel Piccoli and WDR La Sept Cinema
results.brief_description:
A famous director, unable to concentrate on his new script at home with his family, rents a flat in a high rise building. Instead of finding peace and quiet, he gets involved in the tenants’ fight against an exploitative landlord, and with a girl half his age.

Credits: Producers, Alain Sarde, Michel Piccoli, Bertrand Tavernier ; director, Bertrand Tavernier ; writers, Christine Pascal, Charlotte Dubreuil, Bertrand Tavernier ; photography, Alain Levent ; music, Philippe Sarde.
Cast: Michel Piccoli, Christine Pascal, Michel Aumont, Gerard Jugnot, Arlette Bonnard, Genevieve Mnich, Thierry Lhermitte, Michel Blanc, Daniel Toscan du Plantier, Martin Lamotte.
